title: St Mary Magdalene de Pazzi Novena
description: Saint Mary Magdalene de‚Äô Pazzi was an Italian Carmelite nun who lived during the late 16th and early 17th centuries. Pray this novena for the sick, for overcoming temptation, and to grow in mental prayer.

days.prayer:
In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

I adore Thee, O Eternal Father, and I thank Thee on the part of Thy beloved Daughter, St Mary Magdalene de Pazzi, for all the graces Thou granted her, and in particular for having chosen her as the resting place of Thy Divine Being, in that manner, and as far as mortal creatures can become capable thereof, and for having promised her to grant her whatsoever she would ask Thee, saying to her, Bride of My Only-Begotten Word, ask of Me what thou wilt. I beg of Thee, for the sake of her merits and prayers, to infuse into my heart a true humility and conformity to Thy Divine Will. I adore Thee, O Jesus, Word Incarnate, and I thank Thee, on the part of Thy most loving Bride, St Mary Magdalene de Pazzi, for all the gifts Thou granted her, especially for those five with which Thou didst adorn her.

With Thy most sacred stigmata. When Thou didst place a ring on her finger, as to a bride. When Thou gavest her Thy own Heart, as to a true lover. When Thou didst crown her with Thy most sacred crown of thorns. When Thy most holy Mother covered her with the veil of purity, and Thou didst grant her that suffering so much wished for by her. I beg of Thee, for the sake of her merits and prayers, to grant me the grace of imitating Thee and her, and particularly of being willing to suffer for Thy love, and grant me also, I beseech Thee, a perfect observance of Thy divine law and counsels. I especially ask in this novena for the grace of (mention request here‚Ä¶)

I adore Thee, O Spirit Paraclete, and I thank Thee, in the name of Thy dear Disciple, St Mary Magdalene de Pazzi, for all the gifts granted her by Thee, for having chosen her for Thy agreeable dwelling place, and particularly for the seven times Thou didst infuse Thyself into that most pure soul, under seven various forms of cloud, of fire, of column, of river, of dove, of wind, and of flames, in order to strengthen her in the temptations and sufferings she was to endure during the five years of her trial, having made her victorious over hell itself. I beg of Thee, O Spirit of Sovereign Goodness, to grant me strength in all adversities and temptations in life and death, and to enkindle in my heart a burning flame of Thy Love. Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be Saint Mary Magdalene de Pazzi, pray for us!

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
